kimononet.stat

Class StatResults

  • java.lang.Object
    • kimononet.stat.StatResults

  • public class StatResults
extends java.lang.Object
    The class encapsulates specific calculated data gathered from analyzing the data gathered from monitoring packets that are sent from a single source and are delivered to a single sink. Relevant exposed data will include the following values: 
     1. Packets Lost: Calculated as difference between the number of 
    packets that left the source, and the number of packets that arrived at 
    the destination.
 2. Packet Delivery Percentage: Calculated as the ratio between the 
    number of packets received at the sink and the number of packets sent at 
    the source.
 3. Control Overhead: Calculated as the ratio of the number of 
    sent/received beacon packets over the number of sent/received data 
    packets.
 4. Greedy Ratio: Calculated as the ratio of the number of sent packets
    that used greedy over the number of sent packets that used parameter 
    routing.
    Since:
    3/14/2012
    Version:
    3/18/2012
    Author:
    Zorayr Khalapyan

      • StatResults

        public StatResults(int totalPacketCount,
           int sentPackets,
           int receivedPackets,
           int beaconPackets,
           int dataPackets,
           int greedyCount,
           int perimeterCount,
           int totalSentDataPackets,
           int totalReceivedDataPackets,
           int totalSentPackets,
           int totalReceivedPackets)
        Creates a new results package given various count values.
        Parameters:
        totalPacketCount - The total number of all the packets sent and received.
        sentPackets - The total number of sent packets from the sink to the source.
        recievedPackets - The total number of packets received at the sink sent from a single source.
        beaconPackets - The total number of beacon packets sent.
        dataPackets - The total number of data packets sent.
        greedyCount - The total number of packets that used greedy routing algorithm.
        perimeterCount - The total number of packets that used the parameter routing algorithm.

        Creates a new results package with all values set to null.

        public double getControlOverhead()

        Control overhead ratio.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the current results. The output includes the following information. 
         1. Packets Lost: Calculated as difference between the number of 
    packets that left the source, and the number of packets that arrived 
    at the destination.
 2. Packet Delivery Percentage: Calculated as the ratio between the 
    number of packets received at the sink and the number of packets sent 
    at the source.
 3. Control Overhead: Calculated as the ratio of the number of 
    sent beacon packets over the number of total packets.
 4. Greedy Ratio: Calculated as the ratio of the number of sent 
          packets that used greedy over the number of sent packets that used 
          parameter routing.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
